benchmarks.name: S&P 500
benchmarks.description: The S&P 500 is a large cap, blend equity index focused on the US region. It consists of approximately 500 constituents and uses a market cap weighting methodology. This index targets the broad market sector and rebalances quarterly in March, June, September, December. It has a dividend yield of around 1.28% and a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 22.1. It does not apply any explicit factor tilts. ESG focus: No. Minimum account size required is $250,000.

benchmarks.name: S&P 1500
benchmarks.description: The S&P 1500 is a all cap, blend equity index focused on the US region. It consists of approximately 1500 constituents and uses a market cap weighting methodology. This index targets the broad market sector and rebalances quarterly in March, June, September, December. It has a dividend yield of around 1.35% and a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 21.8. It does not apply any explicit factor tilts. ESG focus: No. Minimum account size required is $250,000.
